intro: Sessea acuminata, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-yellow berries that contain the seeds. Sessea acuminata is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
